group_1.narration: Rena only realized how she felt once@she got caught up in that [textBlue:Rumor].
Kaede, Momoko, and I had been fighting@Witches together as a trio for a while.
But when we met Iroha back then,@that's when the situation changed.
Thanks to Momoko's meddling, we took Iroha to the Coordinator and@found out she'd come to Kamihama City to search for her sister...
At first, Rena didn't want to get involved, but she went along@with it anyway because she didn't want to be the bad guy.
But I guess that was where my luck ran out...or maybe,@where it all startedâ€”me realizing how I really felt.
While we were talking about how to find Iroha's sister,@Kaede and I ended up fighting over something stupid.
...Well, that much was business as usual.
Rena got carried away and said too much@and made Kaede cry.
Actually, I even wanted to apologize right away.
But at the time, Momoko was treating me like a kid, and...@it made it hard to say anything...
...No, it wasn't really Momoko's fault.
I think...Rena wasn't even trying to understand@what she was feeling,
Rena was just turning away from her own feelings.
That's why...I got caught up in that@[textBlue:Rumor] I mentioned earlier.
It was all Rena's fault,
since she went along with one of those urban legends@people were talking about at school.
I never wanted to end our friendship...but I still wrote@Kaede's name on the "Friendship Ending Staircase".
But Kaede, not knowing any of that,@just came right out and apologized.
That's just how she always is.
Even though Rena's always the one who starts the fights,@Kaede's always the one who apologizes first.
And every time, I'd always end up hating how I couldn't@be honest with myself...it was so humiliating.
So that's why, back then, Rena felt even more pathetic@than usual...and even lashed out at Momoko, too.
I felt so miserable for not being honest, but actually listening@to my heart would've hurt my pride...I'm such an idiot...!
